header.title: Valley Spirit

tagger.tagNote: 2nd Pass; Andy Morris did first pass.

header.editionNote: Pages 6 to 8 need to be re-scanned.

page.pageNote: Poetry, travelogue, fiction, and a speech from the Pennsylvania Democratic Convention.

div.head: Old House in Juden Strasse: The Rewards of Integrity
div.summary: Story of the origin of the Rothchild's fortunes in the integrity of their ancestor ["The Jew"], who kept the trust of a German prince.

div.head: Jewish Women in Morocco
div.summary: Describes the physical attributes of Jewish women in Morocco.

div.head: The Fruits of Republicanism
div.summary: Stevens and Hazlett, convicted in the Harper's Ferry raid, were executed, which the Valley Spirit applauds.

div.head: Are They Afraid?
div.summary: Attacks Representatives Hickman, Haskin and Adrain for not backing up their corruption charges against President Buchanan.

div.head: Borough Extension
div.summary: Letter arguing that the borough should be extended to bring the tax dollars into Chambersburg and to give Chambersburg room to expand spatially and economically.

div.head: An Amalgamation Case...
div.summary: Story from Connecticut describing an interracial marriage.

div.head: Election
div.excerpt: "The election in this Borough on Friday last was unusually animated so far as the South Ward was concerned, in the North Ward matters were conducted with more moderation."

transcript.p: --The election in this Borough on Friday last was unusually animated so far as the South Ward was concerned, in the North Ward matters were conducted with more moderation. The contest for Justice among our uptown neighbors was quite interesting. T. L. Fletcher was the "regular nominee" of the Republican party. Mr. Samuel Reisher, not liking the manner of the nomination, placed himself on the track as an independent candidate and made a very creditable run--beating the "regular nominee." Mr. H. B. Davison, the Democratic candidate, however, came within a few votes of beating them both and was, of course, elected with the balance of the Democratic ticket in that Ward. The tickets elected in the respective Wards of this borough stand as follows:--North Ward--Judge: W. C. Murry; Inspectors, J. W. Fletcher and W. H. Boyle; Constable, R. F. McClellan; Assessor, Samuel Etter. South Ward--Judge, George Ludwig; Inspectors, A. Martin and G. W. Heagy; Justice of the Peace, H. B. Davison; Constable, Geo. Bittner. If the Election officers in the townships over the county, will furnish us with the names of those elected, particularly the Justices and Constables, we will publish them without any charge, and will feel obliged to any one who will interest himself in procuring them for us.

div.summary: Local election results.

div.head: Gettysburg Railroad
div.excerpt: "A company of gentlemen were engaged, last week, in a survey and examination of a route for the contemplated Railroad between this place and Gettysburg."

transcript.p: --A company of gentlemen were engaged, last week, in a survey and examination of a route for the contemplated Railroad between this place and Gettysburg. They have found the location for the road more favorable than was anticipated. From this place to the South Mountain the road will be almost straight and of very easy grades. A gap has been discovered in the Mountain through which the road can pass at a grade of less than fifty feet to the mile. The survey will be continued on the other side of the Mountain and it is thought, from a cursory examination, that a location for the road can be found as favorable as on this side. The survey will be pushed on energetically and in the course of a few weeks we will have the pleasure of placing the report of the Engineer before our readers.

div.summary: A survey was conducted for a rail route between Chambersburg and Gettysburg. The results were more favorable than expected.

div.head: Handsome Establishment
div.summary: A building on Main Street was remodeled, and a clothing store moved into it.

div.head: Personal Property
div.summary: Property sale of Daniel Trostle's tavern.

div.head: Sudden Death
div.summary: Daughter of local blacksmith died suddenly at a job at a paper mill.

div.head: The Insurgents
div.summary: The brother of Hazlett, one of John Brown's raiders who was executed in Virginia, stopped in Chambersburg to try to obtain the rifle Hazlett left there. Ex-Sheriff Brown refused to give it to him.

div.head: Extension of the Borough
div.summary: The Spirit welcomes communication on the matter of the extension of the borough, but asked that writers refrain from "personal allusions."

div.head: Execution at Charlestown, Va.
div.summary: News story of the execution of Stevens and Hazlett.

div.head: Married
div.summary: Married February 23.

div.head: Married
div.summary: Married March 6.
